alert.note: Alert for Clay (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest North Carolina, including the following county, Clay. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms has now ended. Minor flooding is still possible in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in parts of the advisory area. Heaviest rainfall was in the area between Hayesville and Chatuge Dam. Even though the rain has ended runoff will likely continue for the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hayesville, Tusquitee, Shooting Creek and Brasstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
